What are some other ways to get rid of puffiness?

Beyond the best eye creams for puffiness, there are some tips and tricks that can help as well. “Other ways to reduce puffiness include applying cold compresses or chilled spoons to the eyes to constrict blood vessels and reduce swelling. Staying hydrated, reducing salt intake, and ensuring adequate sleep can also help prevent puffiness,” Dr. Garshick says. Our experts also point out that utilizing a gua sha or jade roller can help with lymphatic drainage, which can decrease puffiness as well. “Always work your way out from the center of your face and then down the neck with your approach,” adds Dr. Mraz.

Can you get rid of eye puffiness permanently?

Although it will be difficult if the puffiness is genetic, if your puffiness is due to environmental or lifestyle factors, you may actually be able to get rid of it for good. “Consistent use of eye creams, a healthy diet, proper hydration, adequate sleep, and avoiding allergens can help minimize puffiness,” says Dr. Garshick. “In some cases, medical treatments like lasers, microneedling, injectables including PRP or fillers, radiofrequency treatments, or surgery may offer more long-lasting results,” she adds. For example, “sometimes, puffiness is actually tied in with excess skin around the eyes area, and would be better treated surgically with a blepharoplasty,” says Dr. Mraz.
